summary: "There are differing levels of toxic workplaces. To me, Ellen DeGeneres doesn't define toxic workplaces."
headline: Toxic workplaces are everywhere, but minimum wage workers know them well
Spice Girl Melanie C says the live music industry needs support
summary: Spice Girl Melanie Chisholm, aka Mel C or Sporty Spice, has told CNBC that the live music industry has been "hit so hard" by the coronavirus pandemic and needs support.
The idea that coders will dominate the future of the job market is wrong, but all workers need to learn some coding if they want a successful career, says former Goldman Sachs CFO Martin Chavez.
headline: A new technology skill every worker needs to be more valuable: Former Goldman Sachs CFO
Senate committee votes to subpoena CEOs of Facebook, Google and Twitter to testify
summary: The Senate Commerce Committee Thursday voted on a bipartisan basis to subpoena the CEOs of Facebook, Google and Twitter to testify.

headline: Hims, a direct-to-consumer health company, is going public via SPAC
summary: The company, which operates both men's and women's health brands and is sometimes called Hims & Hers, is merging with a special purpose acquisition company (SPAC) sponsored by investment management firm Oaktree Capital Management.
After completing it Covid-19 bubble in Canada, NHL Chief Business Officer Keith Wachtel tells CNBC the league hopes to have its virtual advertisement technology for the 2021-22 season.
headline: After bubble experiment, NHL turns to new ad tech to make up for missed revenue due to coronavirus

summary: Microsoft on Thursday announced a new affordable laptop, the Surface Laptop Go, which starts at $549.
headline: Microsoft undercuts MacBook Air with new $549 laptop
Patrick Mahomes agrees to equity deal with performance tech company Hyperice
summary: The Kansas Chiefs quarterback will also be a brand ambassador for the fitness tech company to help expand global brand exposure.
September has been a tough month for traders overall, but a perfect storm left big tech stocks, a sector that normally leads the market, with losses.
headline: Big Tech stocks close out a 'nightmare' September

summary: If you think September was confusing, October is not likely to be any better, and it could be significantly rockier.
headline: Volatile September likely to be followed by rocky October as investors grapple with several risks

summary: FedEx stock closed the third quarter nearly 80% higher, and UPS ended 50% higher.
headline: After FedEx and UPS’ best quarter in decades, traders are backing transports

summary: Google CEO Sundar Pichai has promised to pay news publishers $1 billion over the next three years.
headline: Google says it will pay publishers $1 billion for news in next three years
Bed Bath & Beyond posts same-store sales gain for the first time since 2016 thanks to e-commerce gains
summary: Bed Bath & Beyond on Thursday reported its first same-store sales increase in nearly four years, as its online business surged more than 80% during the quarter.

headline: Investors are bullish on stocks for the 4th quarter, but fear a coronavirus spike
summary: CNBC polled dozens of investors and strategists about where they stood on the upcoming quarter for stocks and the potential election impact.

headline: Coronavirus Has Propelled Us Into the Future of Energy Spending
Microsoft Outlook experiencing problems worldwide

summary: Nvidia's $40 billion acquisition of chip designer Arm will most likely be blocked, according to two technology investors in Britain.

summary: Most of Alibaba's revenue currently comes from its China retail marketplaces that include the Taobao and Tmall shopping platforms as well as its online-to-offline grocery chain.
headline: Alibaba needs to look for growth beyond China and Southeast Asia in a 'bipolar world for technology'
CDC extends ban on cruising through October after White House reportedly overrules longer extension
summary: Executives of the cruise companies and the industry trade group are planning a meeting at the White House on Friday, CNBC's Seema Mody reported.

headline: The U.S. and China could slip into a 'new cold war' that pushes countries to pick sides
summary: The new "cold war" could be a generation long, global economic, military and ideological struggle between the U.S. and China, said Darren Tay of Fitch Solutions.
